title: So Syndra's W got nerfed cause it was ''too hard to miss''
body:
She needed that.

But when do we see {{champion:111}} {{champion:79}} {{champion:25}} {{champion:53}} {{champion:412}} hitboxes fixed?

You realize people aren't going to just stand there and wait for Q to hit them right? It's not exactly a super fast projectile.
Q is far faster than any of those other champions in the op they all have a long wind up time compared to lux whos q starts flying at the beginning  of her animation
blitz and naut grab are faster i believe , and gragas usually does the bs e+flash into minions
I swear her ultimate hitbox is so random at times

Agreed.

Sometimes it feels like the warning red line is just a rough estimate of where it will be, other times it's like the line is the ONLY place it will hit
That doesn't work if you're melee
So wait for her to use it on the wave, then farm. Nearly every melee midlaner beats her, anyways.
I don't think it's healthy for the way to avoid a champion damaging you is, "just don't cs until she is on cd"

Well, its certainly better that ''stay under tower when they hit 6, forever'' which is what you do against melee assassins on midlane.

Melee midlaners suffering is the least of my problems, and garners literally no sympathy from me.

I mean, she's ranged and AoE. Health has nothing to do with anything when it comes to that, it's just a byproduct of how that champion functions at all. I don't think that's unhealthy, I think that's pretty standard.

Thats literally how you play every Ranged vs Melee matchup mid. You get whatever CS you can, but you try to all-in as early and as often as possible since you generally win trades if you close the distance.
Her E isn't about the hitbox tho it's just too fast :p
It was nerfed for that reason? Source please?

"Force of Will is pretty hard to miss, leading to gank setups where the only test of skill is whether Syndra can land Scatter the Weakâ€™s stun on a slow-moving target. We're giving opponents a more realistic chance to dodge Force of Will, which gives them a shot at dodging Scatter the Weak as well."
Fear the Sphere has already presented the quote to add to this further it's source is the [7.11 patch notes](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/game-updates/patch/patch-711-notes#patch-syndra).

>

It does

It's very slightly larger on a few skins (most notably the base skin), but only very slightly. It's more an issue of people juking upwards and being confused about where their _own_ hitbox is. They expect it to miss because it misses their faces, but then they leave their feet - their actual hitbox - in the way. >.>
actually the camera angles mess it up so from the other person's perspective they landed it and for you it looks like it almost grazes you
Camera angle doesn't matter if you're looking at the right part of your model. Your champion's character model is not your hitbox. Your hitbox is the circular shadow around your champion's feet.

^This. It's one of the most stupidly easy projectiles in the game to juke. That's why it can be such a long root - you practically have to walk it into people to land it consistently unless you're much better at Morg than they are at walking. As a main I can land it pretty regularly when I'm awake, but only because bronze 5 + I know how to zone + trickery and can thus get them to juke _into_ it. Every long-range root is a tiny outplay.

You can also use the size of her root against her in lane if you're smart about it. Not gonna go into too many details, because obviously it's not in my best interest for people to figure that out, but that should be enough of a hint if you actually want to learn how to juke it. xD
I'll give the hint of it's how you block Blitz's Q, Thresh's Q, Ahri's E, and how to NOT block Bard's Q.

Morgana has no hitbox problems.
I play her constantly and i never saw my Q hit something that i was clearly supposed to miss.

These all have very heavy drawbacks compared to what they do. Morg q and Thresh hook move incredibly slowly AND thresh has a delay to the ability, blitz hook has a massive cooldown and costs a fortune in mana, and Gragas literally puts himself in the face of the enemy for his cc. The only real big issue of all these abilities is naut's since it's projectile is so big, but it gets blocked by terrain and creeps and pulls him in while not pulling the enemy that far back even for it's how imbalanced it is.

Syndra was nerfed because the ability was too easy to hit for it's ability to enable Syndra's insane burst, had no repercussions mana-wise, and could be fished for catches, something that shouldn't be attached to a 1-shot burst champion.

At rank 5 her W costs the same as most ultimates lol
